text: Elizabeth Marion Llewellyn-Smith (born 17 August 1934) is a British academic administrator, who was the principal of St Hilda's College, Oxford. ==Life== Llewellyn-Smith was born in Upshire, Essex in 1934 and educated at Christ's Hospital and Girton College, Cambridge. She was a senior civil servant and then the eighth principal of St Hilda's College from 1990 to 2001, when she retired. She was appointed a Companion of the Order of the Bath (CB) in the 1985 Birthday Honours. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:Living people Category:People educated at Christ's Hospital Category:Alumni of Girton College, Cambridge Category:Companions of the Order of the Bath Category:Principals of St Hilda's College, Oxford
title: Elizabeth Llewellyn-Smith
